text:
But why isn’t that integrated into the REPL?
I know that the doc string can be accessed in Python, but Julia just makes it so easy!

elements.text: But why isn’t that integrated into the REPL?

text: If you use the `ipython` repl (which you totally should) you can do `somefunctionname?` and it'll print out docs in the terminal.

and it'll print out docs in the terminal.

text:
The notebook/REPL itself, or the combination of Jupyter + Python compared to Julia with its built in REPL?
Have you tried OhMyREPL.jl?

elements.text: The notebook/REPL itself, or the combination of Jupyter + Python compared to Julia with its built in REPL?

text: Pluto will show docs in a side window as you write code in a cell

elements.text: Pluto will show docs in a side window as you write code in a cell

text: Just the ipython REPL. Some stuff like copy pasting into the repl, preserving whitespace, what happens when you hit enter etc, the way it is implemented in ipython I find that makes me ever so slightly more productive than base julia. OhMyREPL certainly makes it better though.

elements.text: Just the ipython REPL. Some stuff like copy pasting into the repl, preserving whitespace, what happens when you hit enter etc, the way it is implemented in ipython I find that makes me ever so slightly more productive than base julia. OhMyREPL certainly makes it better though.
